intro: Corispermum polygaloides, commonly known as the slender sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Eurasia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Its seeds are encased in a hard, dry fruit known as a utricle, which is a common feature in the Polygonaceae family. Corispermum polygaloides is adapted to survive in harsh environments, often thriving in sandy or gravelly soils with limited water availability.
